result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Allan Schmitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dodge County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. 
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling/treatment as directed by agent.

Shall submit a DNA sample. 
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

records.addlTxt:
10:09 AM Defendant Keith Allan Schmitt in court.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Keith Allan Schmitt.  Attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for State of Wisconsin. Court review rights, charges and penalties. Defendant enters Guilty plea to Count 1. Court accepts plea; finds guilty on Count 1; Counts 2 DRI. DA Klomberg heard. Attorney Luchsinger heard. Defendant waives statement. Court heard and imposes sentence: 

**w/held
**2 yr probation
**court costs and supervision fees
**no drugs w/out valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia
**AODA assessment and follow through
**any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent
**absolute sobriety
**DNA sample/surcharge
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:40 AM Defendant Keith Allan Schmitt in court.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Keith Allan Schmitt.  Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court reviews and accepts waiver; binds over to Br 4; proceeds to arraignment. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

12:56 PM Intern Marco Lewis w/Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keith Allan Schmitt appeared by video, in custody. Atty Katherine Marie Findley appeared by video for Keith Schmitt for today only. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1,000.00 PA bond with prior conditions: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
